column4: does that mean if I wantted to install Real Player, I need to install it in /bin?
nope. i don't think so.
i don't think it matters too much
Can I just install it in a directroy called /home/moroinstalls?
well, yes. doesn't it have an auto-installer?
I have to move the bin file into a directory or it will install where it is at. I installed it on my desktop once.
I dont know that I have mastered installing bin files.
http://www.redhat.com/docs/manuals/linux/RHL-9-Manual/ref-guide/s1-filesystem-fhs.html#S3-FILESYSTEM-OPT
this is a description of /opt
thanks Ill read up
So, when I download a bin file, I put it in the opt directory and then perform the install?
hmmm, no. what bin file did  you download? probably an automated install file
RealPlayer
why don't you follow some install instructions on their site?
Man... Ive installed that thing...three or four times. It works, but Firefox wont associate streaming video with it. Totem pops up.
you should check back on the sites or google for "firefox streaming realplayer ubuntu" or something similar
i never used realplayer
What do you use?
for what? video or audio?
Video off the net in real player format
i never streamed real player :) sorry
